hint.metricDescription: Make sure that you use comments. A comment should be placed close to the code it describes. In addition, the terms used in the comment should match the terms in the code. Pay attention to a suitable ratio of comments and code. You should always define a javadoc comment to describe a method.
hint.goodCodeDescription: Here a javadoc and useful other comments are present. The terms in the comments are also the same as in the actual code
hint.badCodeDescription: Here the changePassword method has very few comments. In addition to that no javadoc is present.
